N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 276.3 - Broker qualification

State Regulations
(a) A
broker commission shall be paid only to a real estate broker licensed as such
at the time the sale was procured for the purchaser. (b) A broker seeking to qualify for a broker
commission under section
276.2
(a) of this

Part shall, prior to the day of auction, file with the commissioner a copy of
such broker's real estate broker license along with a sworn affidavit stating, in substance, the following: (1)
the name, business address, affiliation and licensure status of said broker; (2)
the nature of the agreement between the
broker and the bidder-purchaser for procurement of the sale; (3)
in what manner the broker brought
knowledge of the auction to the bidder-purchaser; (4)
that no other commission is sought or
will be paid to the broker on the particular sale; (5)
that no part of the broker commission, if
paid by the commissioner, shall be paid to any other person, firm or legal
entity of any kind or nature, including the bidder-purchaser; (6)
that the bid in the particular sale is
made without collusion and with no attempt to restrict competition; (7)
that the broker is not the purchaser or a
stockholder, director, officer or partner of the bidder-purchaser; (8)
that the bidder-purchaser is not the
broker or stockholder, director, officer or partner of the broker; and
(9)
that the broker and the
bidder-purchaser have no common stockholder, director, officer or
partner. (c) A
bidder-purchaser who employs a broker to procure a sale under this Part shall, prior to the day of auction, file with the commissioner a sworn affidavit
stating, in substance, the following: (1)
name, address and intent to bid at the particular sale; (2)
the nature of the agreement between the
broker and the bidder-purchaser for procurement of the sale; (3)
in what manner the broker brought
knowledge of the auction to the bidder-purchaser; (4)
that the bid in the particular sale is
made without collusion and with no attempt to restrict competition; (5)
that the bidder-purchaser is not the
broker or a stockholder, director, officer or partner of the broker; (6)
that the broker is not the
bidder-purchaser or a stockholder, director, officer or partner of the
bidder-purchaser; (7)
that the
bidder-purchaser and the broker have no common stockholder, director, officer
or partner; and
(8)
that it is
understood that the consummation of the sale is in no way dependent or
contingent upon the payment or nonpayment of the broker commission. (d) The commissioner may modify
the content of the sworn affidavits required under subdivisions (b) and (c) of
this section and may require other and further affidavits, documentation and
information as may be deemed necessary in making a determination as to payment
or nonpayment of the broker commission. Notes
